newsitem.title: USA: American Home to appeal patent ruling.
newsitem.headline: American Home to appeal patent ruling.

text.p: American Home Products Corp said Tuesday it would appeal a court ruling ordering it to pay a university and other plaintiffs about $45 million for defrauding them of a vitamin supplement patent.
"American Home Products believes that the Court misinterpreted the evidence and misapplied the law and will promptly appeal the decision," it said in a statement.

On June 7, the U.S. District Court for the District of Colorado ordered the company's American Cyanamid Co subsidiary to pay the University of Colorado and affiliated entities and individuals $44 million in compensatory damages and $1.0 million in punitive damages.
Judge John Kane said the two researchers involved in the suit against the company were the inventors of the reformulated version of Materna, a pre-natal, multi-vitamin supplement.
American Home said Cyanamid denied that the researchers were the inventors of the supplement even though they had conducted studies relating to its reformulation in the early 1980s.
The company acquired Cyanamid in November 1994 after the lawsuit had been filed.
American Home Products makes prescription and over-the-counter drugs.
